verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:341
verses.text: Hence arises discord, the seed-plot of divorce.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:342
verses.text: Or suppose you find me a house where these things are unknown, which is a rara avis indeed! yet even there the very management of the household, the education of the children, the wants of the husband, the correction of the servants, cannot fail to call away the mind from the thought of God.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:343
verses.text: "It had ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women": so the Scripture says, and afterwards Abraham received the command, "In all that Sarah saith unto thee, hearken unto her voice".

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:344
verses.text: She who is not subject to the anxiety and pain of child-bearing and having passed the change of life has ceased to perform the functions of a woman, is freed from the curse of God: nor is her desire to her husband, but on the contrary her husband becomes subject to her, and the voice of the Lord commands him, "In all that Sarah saith unto thee, hearken unto her voice".

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:345
verses.text: Thus they begin to have time for prayer.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:346
verses.text: For so long as the debt of marriage is paid, earnest prayer is neglected.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:347
Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:348
verses.text: I do not deny that holy women are found both among widows and those who have husbands; but they are such as have ceased to be wives, or such as, even in the close bond of marriage, imitate virgin chastity.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:349
verses.text: The Apostle, Christ speaking in him, briefly bore witness to this when he said,"She that is unmarried is careful for the things of the Lord, how she may please the Lord: but she that is married is careful for the things of the world, how she may please her husband".

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:350
verses.text: He leaves us the free exercise of our reason in the matter.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:351
verses.text: He lays no necessity upon anyone nor leads anyone into a snare: he only persuades to that which is proper when he wishes all men to be as himself.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:352
verses.text: He had not, it is true, a commandment from the Lord respecting virginity, for that grace surpasses the unassisted power of man, and it would have worn an air of immodesty to force men to fly in the face of nature, and to say in other words, I want you to be what the angels are.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:353
verses.text: It is this angelic purity which secures to virginity its highest reward, and the Apostle might have seemed to despise a course of life which involves no guilt.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:354
verses.text: Nevertheless in the immediate context he adds, "But I give my judgment, as one that hath obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:355
verses.text: I think therefore that this is good by reason of the present distress, namely, that it is good for a man to be as he is".

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:356
verses.text: What is meant by present distress?"Woe unto them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days!" The reason why the wood grows up is that it may be cut down.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:357
verses.text: The field is sown that it may be reaped.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:358
verses.text: The world is already full, and the population is too large for the soil.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:359
verses.text: Every day we are being cut down by war, snatched away by disease, swallowed up by shipwreck, although we go to law with one another about the fences of our property.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:360
verses.text: It is only one addition to the general rule which is made by those who follow the Lamb, and who have not defiled their garments, for they have continued in their virgin state.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:361
verses.text: Notice the meaning of defiling.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:362
verses.text: I shall not venture to explain it, for fear Helvidius may be abusive.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:363
verses.text: I agree with you, when you say, that some virgins are nothing but tavern women; I say still more, that even adulteresses may be found among them, and, you will no doubt be still more surprised to hear, that some of the clergy are inn-keepers and some monks unchaste.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:364
verses.text: Who does not at once understand that a tavern woman cannot be a virgin, nor an adulterer a monk, nor a clergy-man a tavern-keeper? Are we to blame virginity if its counterfeit is at fault? For my part, to pass over other persons and come to the virgin, I maintain that she who is engaged in huckstering, though for anything I know she may be a virgin in body, is no longer one in spirit.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:365
Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:366
verses.text: I have become rhetorical, and have disported myself a little like a platform orator.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:367
verses.text: You compelled me, Helvidius; for, brightly as the Gospel shines at the present day, you will have it that equal glory attaches to virginity and to the marriage state.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:368
verses.text: And because I think that, finding the truth too strong for you, you will turn to disparaging my life and abusing my character (it is the way of weak women to talk tittle-tattle in corners when they have been put down by their masters), I shall anticipate you.

verses.name: Jerome: the Perpetual Virginity of Blessed Mary 1:369
verses.text: I assure you that I shall regard your railing as a high distinction, since the same lips that assail me have disparaged Mary, and I, a servant of the Lord, am favoured with the same barking eloquence as His mother.
